title: Coroner identifies 3-year-old killed in accidental shooting
content:
GASTON, SC (WIS) -
The Lexington County Coroner's Office has identified a 3-year-old who was killed as a result of an accidental shooting.
Coroner Margaret Fisher says Brooklyn Samiya Davis was fatally wounded at a residence on Glenn Road in Gaston on July 18.
Fisher stopped short of revealing Davis' cause of death, but said the case remains under investigation by her office as well as the Lexington County Sheriff's Department.
Davis, according to the sheriff's department, accidentally shot herself in the incident, but further details have not yet been released. Davis was in critical condition for several days before she eventually passed away.
The Major Crimes Unit is investigating how the child got access to the gun.
Per a spokeswoman with the state Department of Social Services, the agency received a report regarding the incident on July 18. The complaint came to the DSS’ Child Protective Services department. Because of the report, DSS is investigating.
At this time, they can’t release any other information. However, if the fact that DSS has a case and the nature of that case is made in the public domain, then DSS could release further information.
